intro: Hybanthus brexifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
